hu.kazocsaba.columntable

Class ColumnTableModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      • hu.kazocsaba.columntable.ColumnTableModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, TableModel

    public abstract class ColumnTableModel
extends AbstractTableModel
    A table model which describes the data in a column-by-column fashion. Subclasses should initialize the columns themselves by calling addColumns(Column[]) in the constructor.

    Sample usage: This example defines a model backed by a list of strings. It has three columns: an index, the editable string value, and the hash code of the string. 

    
public class StringModel extends ColumnTableModel {
   private final List<String> data=new ArrayList<>();
   private final Column indexColumn=new Column("Index", Integer.class) {

      @Override
      public Object get(int row) {
         return row+1;
      }
 
   };
   private final Column stringColumn=new Column("Value", String.class, true) {

      @Override
      public Object get(int row) {
         return data.get(row);
      }

      @Override
      public void set(Object aValue, int row) {
         data.set(row, (String)aValue);
         fireTableRowsUpdated(row, row);
      }

   };
   private final Column hashColumn=new Column("Hash", Integer.class) {

      @Override
      public Object get(int row) {
         return data.get(row).hashCode();
      }

   };

   public StringModel() {
      addColumns(indexColumn, stringColumn, hashColumn);
   }

   @Override
   public int getRowCount() {
      return data.size();
   }
 
   public void add(String element) {
      Objects.requireNonNull(element);
      data.add(element);
      fireTableRowsInserted(data.size()-1, data.size()-1);
   }
}
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

      • addColumns

        protected final void addColumns(Column... columns)
        Adds the specified columns to this model.
        Parameters:
        columns - the columns to add

      • getColumnIndex

        public int getColumnIndex(Column column)
        Returns the index of the specified column. If the model does not contain the column, -1 is returned. If it contains multiple instances of the column, the index of the first occurence is returned.
        Parameters:
        column - a column
        Returns:
        the index of the column, or -1 if the model does not contain the column
